ilex.fittingÔÉÅ

fit_RMquad(Q, U, Qerr, Uerr, f, f0, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ
Info:

Use Quadratic method to fit for RM and pa0.

Parameters:

  • Q (np.ndarray) ‚Äì stokes Q spectra

  • U (np.ndarray) ‚Äì stokes U spectra

  • Qerr (np.ndarray) ‚Äì stokes Q rms spectra

  • Uerr (np.ndarray) ‚Äì stokes U rms spectra

  • f (np.ndarray) ‚Äì frequencies [MHz]

  • f0 (float) ‚Äì reference Frequency [MHz]

  • **kwargs (Dict) ‚Äì keyword arguments for RM tools run_synthesis

Returns:

  • rm (float) ‚Äì rotation measure

  • rm_err (float) ‚Äì error in rotation measure

  • pa0 (float) ‚Äì position angle at f0

  • pa0_err (float) ‚Äì position angle err

fit_RMsynth(I, Q, U, Ierr, Qerr, Uerr, f, clean_cutoff=0.1, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Use RM synthesis to calculate RM, pa0 and f0, f0 is the weighted midband frequency and pa0 the pa at f0.

Parameters:

  • I (np.ndarray) ‚Äì stokes I spectra

  • Q (np.ndarray) ‚Äì stokes Q spectra

  • U (np.ndarray) ‚Äì stokes U spectra

  • Ierr (np.ndarray) ‚Äì stokes I rms spectra

  • Qerr (np.ndarray) ‚Äì stokes Q rms spectra

  • Uerr (np.ndarray) ‚Äì stokes U rms spectra

  • f (np.ndarray) ‚Äì frequencies [MHz]

  • clean_cutoff (float) ‚Äì cutoff arg for run_rmclean()

  • **kwargs (Dict) ‚Äì keyword arguments for RM tools run_synthesis

Returns:

  • rm (float) ‚Äì rotation measure

  • rm_err (float) ‚Äì error in rotation measure

  • f0 (float) ‚Äì reference frequency at weighted mid-band

  • pa0 (float) ‚Äì position angle at f0

class fit_par[source]ÔÉÅ

Class for holding priors and posteriors of fitted functions. To Be Implemented - Stats functions

Type:

add_param(key, val, plus, minus)[source]ÔÉÅ

Add parameter to current instance of fit_par class

Parameters:

  • key (str) ‚Äì parameter name

  • val (float) ‚Äì bestfit/median of posterior

  • plus (float) ‚Äì Positive err

  • minus (float) ‚Äì Negative err

fit_scint(f, I, priors, static_priors, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Fit spectra for scintillation bandwidth

Parameters:

  • f (np.ndarray) ‚Äì Frequency array [MHz] [in asending order, low end of band first]

  • I (np.ndarray) ‚Äì Stokes I spectra

  • priors (Dict) ‚Äì

    priors

    [a] - amplitude of lorentz function

    [w] - Scintillation bandwidth

    [sigma] - rms in freq

  • static_priors (Dict) ‚Äì

    priors to keep static during fitting and their vales

    [sigma] - if sigma is kept static, an array can be used with the same size as f

  • **kwargs (Dict) ‚Äì Additional arguments for BILBY [run_sampler] function

  • Return ‚Äì

  • p (fit_par) ‚Äì Posterior data container

fit_tscatt(t, I, npulse, priors, static_priors, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

Fit time series with some n number of convolved gaussians

Parameters:

  • t (np.ndarray) ‚Äì Time array in [ms]

  • I (np.ndarray) ‚Äì Stokes I time series

  • npulse (int) ‚Äì Number of convolved gaussians to fit

  • priors (Dict) ‚Äì

    priors, for each pulse n:

    [a[n]] - amplitude

    [mu[n]] - Position in [ms]

    [sig[n]] - HWHM in [ms]

    [tau] - Scattering time scale

    [sigma] - rms in time

  • static_priors (Dict) ‚Äì

    priors to keep static during fitting and their vales

    [sigma] - if sigma is static, an array can be used of the same size as t

  • **kwargs (Dict) ‚Äì Additional arguments for BILBY [run_sampler] function

Returns:

p ‚Äì Posterior data container

Return type:

fit_par

func_fit(x, y, fit_func, fit_priors: dict | None = None, static_priors: dict | None = None, **kwargs)[source]ÔÉÅ

General Purpose Function for Sampling Posterior of a function through Bilby. This function has the ability of constraining priors of a chosen function to keep constant during sampling which is done by wrapping chosen function in a temporary lambda function.

This function also saves result.plot_data() and result.corner()

Parameters:

  • x (np.ndarray) ‚Äì X data

  • y (np.ndarray) ‚Äì Y data

  • fit_func (str) ‚Äì Function to sample

  • fit_priors (dict, optional) ‚Äì Priors to sample, by default None

  • static_priors (dict, optional) ‚Äì Parameters to keep constant during sampling, by default None

Returns:

data container for posteriors

Return type:

fit_par

gaussian(x, a, mu, sig)[source]ÔÉÅ

Gaussian Pulse Function

Parameters:

  • x (np.ndarray) ‚Äì X data

  • a (float) ‚Äì amplitude

  • mu (float) ‚Äì position of Gaussian Pulse

  • sig (float) ‚Äì width of Gaussian Pulse

Returns:

Y data

Return type:

np.ndarray

lorentz(x, w, a)[source]ÔÉÅ

Lorentz function - Usually used to model scintillation bandwidth

Parameters:

  • x (np.ndarray) ‚Äì X data - Usually Frequency array

  • w (float) ‚Äì width - Usually Scintillation Bandwidth

  • a (float) ‚Äì Amplitude - Usually m^2 where m is modulation index

Returns:

Y data

Return type:

np.ndarray

model_curve(y, n: int = 5, samp: int | None = None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Fit Polynomial model to data

Parameters:

  • y (np.ndarray) ‚Äì data to model

  • n (int, optional) ‚Äì Polynomial order, by default 5

  • samp (int, optional) ‚Äì number of samples to sample modelled data, by default None

Returns:

Modelled data

Return type:

np.ndarray

1 sided (positive side) exponential Scattering tail function

  • tau (float) ‚Äì Scattering Timescale

Returns:

Y data

scatt_pulse_profile(x, p)[source]ÔÉÅ

Scattering time series profile with n pulses

Parameters:

  • x (np.ndarray) ‚Äì X data array

  • p (Dict(float)) ‚Äì

    dictionary of parameters for scattered Gaussian pulses, for each pulse n:

    [a[n]] - Pulse amplitude

    [mu[n]] - Pulse position

    [sig[n]] - Pulse width

    [tau] - scattering timescale

Returns:

y ‚Äì Y data array

Return type:

np.ndarray

  • alpha (float) ‚Äì Power-law index
